column10: Driver traveling on West Ox Rd and turning right onto Centreville Rd do not stop at the red light. Often times if they do stop, they block the cross walk

drivers blow through this stop light and cross walk routinely.  It's actually the most unsafe crosswalk there is and we must cross the road upstream without a crosswalk because its safer than hoping people stop.  Its extremely unsafe.

Drivers continually run the red light from all directions.  I and my small children have almost been run over several times at this intersection - while IN the crosswalk WITH active walking signs.  Its not safe here at all.

Driver's routinely blow through the red light right hand turn coming off of West Ox Rd from the West onto Centreville Rd. to go North.  It's a wreckless blind turn that drivers blow over the cross walk without stopping at a red light.  Unfortunately this whole intersection is dangerous, even with a Firestation there, and the Floris elementary school there, drivers constantly blow through the Red light, Yellow light and speed well past the posted 45mph limit.  Its scary because children, and many people use the crosswalk properly and still can get hit at a stale Red light.  It's a very dangerous intersection.
column21: Traffic police would have a field day with this position and be able to issue many tickets from the constant illegal and dangerous driving that occurs here.  Someone will get killed here.
